definition[0]: a piece of special glass that you can look at and see yourself in
example[0]: He spends hours in front of the mirror!
example[1]: When I looked in the mirror I couldn’t believe it. I looked fantastic!
example[2]: She was studying her reflection in the mirror.
definition[1]: a mirror on the inside or side of a vehicle, which the driver uses to see what is behind
example[3]: Check your rear-view mirror before you drive away.
definition[2]: if one thing mirrors another, it is very similar to it and may seem to copy or represent it
example[5]: Henry’s sad smile mirrored that of his son.
example[6]: The economic recovery in Britain was mirrored in the US.
definition[3]: another name for the The Daily Mirror
